Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui

Class GUIManager

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.GUIManager
public class GUIManager
extends javafx.application.Application
Manager for the GUI class. Extends Application, the entry point for JavaFX applications, so that a GUI can be started through the launch() method.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javafx.application.Application

    • setBusy

      public boolean setBusy​(boolean val)
      If the current value of busy is !val, sets busy to val. Returns true if successful, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      val - the updated value to set busy to
      Returns:
      true if val was set to the received argument, false otherwise

    • isBusy

      public boolean isBusy()
      Returns:
      true if the GUIManager is busy, false otherwise

    • start

      public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws java.lang.Exception
      Handles the initialization of all the Controllers and all the scenes. Sets the stage attribute as the primaryStage received as argument; all the scenes will be set on this stage. Sets the title of the stage, his size, his FXML Controller and other attributes.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - the primary Stage
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - when an exception occurs while loading the Parent using the FXMLLoader

    • initAll

      public void initAll()
      Calls all the methods that will initialize the Controllers and the scenes.

    • initLogin

      public void initLogin()
      Loads the loginController from the associated FXML resource, sets its loginScene and initializes it.

      private void initNewGame()
      Loads the newGameController from the associated FXML resource, sets its newGameScene and initializes it.

      Loads the joinGameController from the associated FXML resource, sets its joinGameScene and initializes it.

    • setScene

      private void setScene​(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Parameters:
      scene - the Scene to set the currentScene attribute to

    • putObject

      public void putObject​(java.lang.Object object)
      Starts a new Thread to offer the Object received as argument (an input provided by the client) on the messageQueue.
      Parameters:
      object - the Object to offer on the messageQueue

    • displayMessage

      public void displayMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Allows the player to display a message received from the server.
      Parameters:
      message - the message sent

    • chooseYesNo

      public void chooseYesNo​(java.lang.String query)
      Allows the Player to answer to a "yes or no question". Depending on the currentScene, the chooseYesNo method is called on the right Controller, which will show the question and provide the client's answer.
      Parameters:
      query - the "yes or no question" the Player should answer to

    • getServerIp

      public void getServerIp()
      When loginController is not null sets the currentScene attribute of the GUIManager as the loginScene.

    • chooseNickname

      public void chooseNickname​(boolean taken)
      Allows the Player to choose his nickname. The chooseNickname method is called on the loginController, which will show the question and provide the client's answer.
      Parameters:
      taken - if the previously chosen nickname is already taken, false otherwise

    • serverErrorMessage

      public void serverErrorMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Allows notifying the Player of an error message coming from the server. The errorMessage method is called on the loginController, which will show the error message.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to show

    • chooseStartJoin

      public void chooseStartJoin()
      Allows the Player to choose to start a new Game or joining an existing one. Initializes the Game Lobby and sets the currentScene attribute of the GUIManager as the gameLobbyScene. The gameLobbyController initialization will provide to show the question and to notice the client's answer.

    • chooseGameName

      public void chooseGameName​(boolean taken)
      Allows the Player to choose to choose a Game name. Initializes the new Game and sets the currentScene attribute of the GUIManager as the newGameScene. The newGameController will provide to show the question and to notice the client's answer.
      Parameters:
      taken - if the previously chosen Game name is already taken, false otherwise

    • choosePlayersNumber

      public void choosePlayersNumber()
      Allows the Player to choose the number of Players for the Game he is creating. The newGameController will provide to show the question and to notice the client's answer.

    • chooseGameRoom

      public void chooseGameRoom​(java.util.ArrayList<GameView> gameRooms)
      Allows the Player to choose which Game room to join among those available. Sets the currentScene attribute of the GUIManager as the joinGameScene The joinGameController will provide to show the question and to notice the client's answer.
      Parameters:
      gameRooms - an ArrayList containing all the Game rooms the Player can choose among

    • notifyGameStarting

      public void notifyGameStarting()
      Allows the Player to be notified that the Game is starting. The gameStartingController will provide showing the information.

    • displayGameInfo

      public void displayGameInfo​(GameView game, java.lang.String desc)
      Depending on the received information, the right method is called on the Controller which is supposed to display that information. This may require the initialization of Controllers not yet initialized and the setting of the appropriate scene.
      Parameters:
      game - the GameView representing the current state of the Game
      desc - the information to display

    • chooseCards

      public void chooseCards​(java.util.ArrayList<CardView> possibleCards, int num, java.util.ArrayList<CardView> pickedCards)
      Allows the Player to choose some Cards between those available. He could be asked to choose the 2 or 3 Cards to be used in a 2 or 3-players Game, or his own Card for the Game. Depending on the choice he has to make, the right method is called on the gameSetUpController.
      Parameters:
      possibleCards - an ArrayList containing all the available Cards
      num - the number of Cards to choose
      pickedCards - an ArrayList containing all the already picked Cards

    • chooseStartingPlayer

      public void chooseStartingPlayer​(java.util.ArrayList<PlayerView> players)
      Allows the Player to choose the starting Player. The gameBoardController will handle the choice and will provide the client's answer.
      Parameters:
      players - an ArrayList of PlayerViews representing all the Players involved in the Game

    • choosePosition

      public void choosePosition​(java.util.ArrayList<CellView> positions, java.lang.String desc)
      Allows the Player to choose a position. The gameBoardController will handle the choice and will provide the client's answer.
      Parameters:
      positions - an ArrayList containing CellViews representing all the available positions
      desc - the reason of the choice

    • displayBuild

      public void displayBuild​(CellView buildPosition, CardView godCard)
      Notifies the Player that a new build occurred. The gameBoardController will handle the displaying of this new build.
      Parameters:
      buildPosition - the CellView representing the position of the building
      godCard - the CardView representing the God Card which eventually allowed this build

    • displayMove

      public void displayMove​(java.util.HashMap<CellView,​CellView> moves, CardView godCard)
      Notifies the Player that a new move occurred. The gameBoardController will handle the displaying of this new move.
      Parameters:
      moves - an HashMap containing pairs of (starting position, final position) for each worker who moved or was forced to move
      godCard - the CardView representing the God Card which eventually allowed this move

    • displayPlaceWorker

      public void displayPlaceWorker​(CellView position)
      Notifies the Player that a Worker was placed on its starting position. The gameBoardController will handle the displaying of this placing.
      Parameters:
      position - the starting position of a Worker

    • notifyLoss

      public void notifyLoss​(java.lang.String reason, PlayerView player)
      Notifies a Player that he lost. The gameBoardController will handle this notification.
      Parameters:
      reason - the reason of the loss
      player - the PlayerView representing the Player who eventually won, can be null

    • notifyWin

      public void notifyWin​(java.lang.String reason)
      Notifies a Player that he won. The gameBoardController will handle this notification.
      Parameters:
      reason - the reason of the victory

    • notifyDisconnection

      public void notifyDisconnection​(PlayerView player)
      Notifies a Player that another Player disconnected. The gameOverController will handle this notification.
      Parameters:
      player - the PlayerView representing the Player who disconnected

    • notifyGameOver

      public void notifyGameOver()
      Notifies a Player that the Game is over. The gameOverController will handle this notification.

    • serverClosed

      public void serverClosed()
      Notifies a Player that the server is down. The gameOverController will handle this notification.
